transportAdvice: Luxembourg City is compact and walkable, with the historic Old Town and main attractions easily covered on foot; the country offers free public transit including buses that connect tourist areas, and taxis are readily available for longer journeys or late-night travel.

weather.description: Cold and grey with occasional frost or light snow, typical of a northern European winter.
Still cold with short days, though slightly more daylight begins to return toward month's end.
Early spring brings mild warming but expect cool temperatures and occasional showers.
Pleasant spring conditions with blooming greenery, though rain remains common throughout the month.
Warm and increasingly sunny, one of the more enjoyable months to explore the city outdoors.
Comfortable early summer weather with long daylight hours and occasional afternoon thunderstorms.
The warmest month of the year with long sunny days, ideal for sightseeing and outdoor dining.
Warm and pleasant with conditions similar to July, though brief thunderstorms can occur.
Early autumn brings cooler evenings and beautiful foliage beginning to appear across the valleys.
Noticeably cooler and wetter with autumn colours at their peak in the surrounding gorges and parks.
Grey and damp with temperatures dropping steadily, though Christmas market preparations add charm.
Cold and festive with popular Christmas markets in the city centre brightening the short winter days.
